title: Is Elton John a Republican? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, no. He’s a Brit. He’s not a citizen, can’t vote, and party membership would be pointless.He’s had his lawyers demand that Trump stop playing his songs at his rallies. So have Neil Young, Prince’s estate, The Rolling Stones, many others. Of course, Trump ignores them, whereas if you and I made a film and included “1999” in it, we would pay through the nose.Log cabin republicans notwithstanding, a large majority of the LGBTQ community are not in favor of a guy who’s policies are set to strip people of their rights to be treated like human beings.

No, and he’s not a Democrat either. Sir Elton is a British citizen, and his politics reflect his views about his country: for example, he is not in favor of Brexit, and does not believe the UK should leave the European Union. He has also spent years advocating for policies that would be associated with liberals in the United States— gay rights, finding a cure for AIDS, etc. But he has not openly affiliated with either liberals of conservatives, nor have I heard him give any political speeches. He seems to think of himself first and foremost as a musician, and he tries to avoid getting involved with political battles.
